text:
Twelfth Avenue, northwest from West 54th Street, as viewed from the northwest corner of Dewitt Clinton Park, showing North River piers on the west side of the Avenue. At the right is a clearance extending between 54th and 55th Streets that is to be included in the widening of this Avenue.

April 14, 1931
March 29, 1934

P. L. Sperr

No. 3

A view across the N. E. corner of West 54th Street, showing the piers obscured by the new continuation of the West Side Vehicular Highway.

June 22, 1937

W. P. A. photo
Five Boroughs Project

(1) West 54th Street, east from Twelfth, to, but not including Eleventh Aves. View shows De Witt Clinton Park, in the foreground.

October 3, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, slightly westward. Eventually Twelfth Ave., will replace ditch on the right.

August 29, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, as No. 2, showing a closer view of ditch.

August 12, 1933.

P L. Sperr.

Looking south east across a squatters shack, at the N.E. corner of 54th Street and Twelfth Ave.

October 3, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Squatters Colony at the corner of West 54th Street near 12th Avenue.

text:
(1)
West 54th Street, between Twelfth Ave., (stone wall) and the Hudson River, and showing workmen preparing site for new piers. De Witt Clinton Park, is shown on the eastern side of Twelfth Ave.
March 29, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, but not showing the street pavement.
March 29, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A closer view of men drilling.
March 29, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
